titleStmt.title: A briefe memento to the present un-parliamentary junto touching their present intentions and proceedings, to depose & execute Charles Steward, their lawfull King. By William Prynne Esquire, a Member of the House of Commons, and prisoner under the Armies tyranny; who, it seemes, have levyed war against the Houses of Parliament, their quandam-masters whose Members they now forcibly take and detaine captives, during their lawfull pleasures.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

titleStmt.title: A briefe memento to the present un-parliamentary junto touching their present intentions and proceedings, to depose & execute Charles Steward, their lawfull King. By William Prynne Esquire, a Member of the House of Commons, and prisoner under the Armies tyranny; who, it seemes, have levyed war against the Houses of Parliament, their quandam-masters whose Members they now forcibly take and detaine captives, during their lawfull pleasures.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

notesStmt.note: In the space following "quandam-masters" on title page is the Latin abbreviation for "-bus".
The publication year is given according to Lady Day dating.
Reproduction of the original at the British Library.
